internal_fact: The company has not entered into a partnership with Tesla.
external_claim: The company currently has no partnership agreement with Tesla.
reason_same: Both state there is no Tesla partnership in effect at present.
reason_not_same: Internal could be about past action (not entered) while external could allow informal collaboration or talks without an agreement.

internal_fact: No layoffs are planned for the upcoming fiscal year.
external_claim: The company does not expect layoffs in the upcoming fiscal year.
reason_same: ‘Planned’ and ‘does not expect’ both communicate layoffs are not anticipated.
reason_not_same: ‘Planned’ is a concrete internal plan; ‘does not expect’ is a forecast that could still allow contingency plans.

internal_fact: Management is reviewing cost structures across departments.
external_claim: Management is considering cost-saving measures across departments.
reason_same: Reviewing costs is commonly done to identify cost-saving measures.
reason_not_same: A review could be informational only; ‘considering measures’ implies intent to act.

internal_fact: The pilot program on Product A ended earlier than initially scheduled.
external_claim: The Product A pilot concluded ahead of schedule.
reason_same: Both say the pilot ended earlier than planned.
reason_not_same: Internal might mean terminated prematurely (problem); external frames it as smoothly ‘concluded’.

internal_fact: Expansion into Southeast Asia remains under evaluation.
external_claim: Southeast Asia is being considered as a potential expansion region.
reason_same: Both describe the same exploration stage for expansion.
reason_not_same: ‘Under evaluation’ could include a broader strategy review, while ‘being considered’ could imply a lighter, less formal process.

internal_fact: The board approved a revised 2026 operating plan on 12 Dec 2025.
external_claim: On 12 Dec 2025, the board signed off on an updated 2026 operating plan.
reason_same: ‘Approved’ and ‘signed off’ are standard equivalents in governance contexts.
reason_not_same: ‘Revised’ vs ‘updated’ may differ in magnitude; ‘signed off’ could be informal acknowledgment rather than formal approval.

internal_fact: The company will pause hiring for non-critical roles through Q2 2026.
external_claim: Hiring will be limited to critical roles through Q2 2026.
reason_same: Both indicate only critical roles will be hired for in that period.
reason_not_same: ‘Pause’ suggests a hard stop; ‘limited’ suggests some discretion beyond critical roles.

internal_fact: Customer churn declined from 3.2% to 2.9% in Q4 2025.
external_claim: Q4 2025 churn fell to 2.9% from 3.2%.
reason_same: Same numbers and direction; just reordered.
reason_not_same: Internal may be net churn; external could be gross churn if not specified in the claim.

internal_fact: The company is renegotiating its primary logistics contract effective March 2026.
external_claim: The company is in talks to update its main logistics contract for March 2026.
reason_same: Renegotiating and being in talks to update capture the same activity and timing.
reason_not_same: ‘Renegotiating’ implies active contract terms bargaining; ‘in talks’ could include early discussions without renegotiation.

internal_fact: The new pricing policy applies to new customers starting 1 Feb 2026.
external_claim: Starting 1 Feb 2026, the new pricing policy will affect new customer sign-ups.
reason_same: Both set the same date and scope (new customers).
reason_not_same: Internal could exclude renewals; external could be read as covering any new sign-up events including renewals treated as sign-ups.

internal_fact: The company received 14 formal bids during the RFP window (1–20 Nov 2025).
external_claim: The RFP period (1–20 Nov 2025) resulted in 14 bids.
reason_same: Same count and same RFP period; paraphrase.
reason_not_same: ‘Formal bids’ is specific; ‘bids’ might include incomplete or non-compliant submissions.

internal_fact: The merger integration timeline was extended by two weeks due to data migration issues.
external_claim: Data migration issues pushed the integration timeline back by about two weeks.
reason_same: Both attribute a ~2-week delay to data migration problems.
reason_not_same: ‘Extended’ could mean official plan revision; ‘pushed back’ could mean slippage without formal re-baselining; ‘about’ adds uncertainty.

internal_fact: The company expects 2026 capex to be between $480M and $520M.
external_claim: 2026 capex is projected at roughly $500M.
reason_same: A midpoint summary (~$500M) reasonably represents the stated range.
reason_not_same: A point estimate loses the uncertainty range and could mislead if capex lands at extremes.

internal_fact: The sales team expanded coverage to 12 additional cities in Latin America.
external_claim: The company increased Latin America sales coverage by adding 12 cities.
reason_same: Both state the same expansion by 12 cities in Latin America.
reason_not_same: ‘Expanded coverage’ might be partial presence; ‘adding cities’ could imply full local offices or direct operations.

internal_fact: The company’s largest customer represented 9.8% of revenue in FY2025.
external_claim: The top customer accounted for about 10% of FY2025 revenue.
reason_same: Rounding 9.8% to ‘about 10%’ is common and directionally consistent.
reason_not_same: ‘Largest’ vs ‘top’ is similar, but ‘about 10%’ may obscure a materiality threshold just under 10%.

internal_fact: Management said the restructuring will not affect customer-facing support hours.
external_claim: Management said customer-facing support hours will remain unchanged during the restructuring.
reason_same: Both assert customer-facing support hours won’t change.
reason_not_same: ‘Will not affect’ could allow temporary fluctuations; ‘remain unchanged’ implies stricter invariance.

internal_fact: The company’s net promoter score rose by 4 points after the November release.
external_claim: After the November release, NPS increased by four points.
reason_same: Same metric change and same temporal anchor.
reason_not_same: Internal might mean a statistically adjusted NPS; external could imply raw NPS without methodology.

internal_fact: The procurement policy requires two approvals for purchases above CHF 50,000.
external_claim: Purchases over CHF 50,000 need two approvers under the procurement policy.
reason_same: Same threshold and same rule; wording differs.
reason_not_same: ‘Above’ excludes exactly CHF 50,000; ‘over’ may be interpreted the same but could include CHF 50,000 depending on policy language.

internal_fact: The company will sunset Product B on 30 Sep 2026.
external_claim: Product B will be discontinued at the end of September 2026.
reason_same: Same month and end-of-life concept.
reason_not_same: ‘30 Sep’ is exact; ‘end of September’ could mean earlier/later operational cutoffs and different time zones.

internal_fact: The internal audit found three control gaps rated 'medium' severity.
external_claim: The audit identified three medium-severity control gaps.
reason_same: Same count and severity category; paraphrase.
reason_not_same: ‘Internal audit’ vs ‘audit’ could be confused with external audit; rating rubric might differ from plain ‘medium-severity’.

internal_fact: The company plans to open one new warehouse in Poland in 2026.
external_claim: A warehouse expansion in Poland is planned for 2026.
reason_same: Both indicate a planned warehouse addition in Poland in 2026.
reason_not_same: External omits ‘one’ and could imply multiple warehouses or broader expansion beyond a single site.

internal_fact: The marketing campaign will run for 8 weeks starting 15 Jan 2026.
external_claim: Starting 15 Jan 2026, the campaign is scheduled for an eight-week run.
reason_same: Same start date and duration.
reason_not_same: ‘Will run’ suggests confirmed execution; ‘scheduled’ could imply it may still change.

internal_fact: The company’s customer satisfaction survey had 1,040 respondents.
external_claim: The satisfaction survey included about 1,000 respondents.
reason_same: Rounded respondent count captures the same scale.
reason_not_same: Rounding may be misleading for margin-of-error calculations; ‘about 1,000’ could hide whether 1,040 met a sampling threshold.

internal_fact: The company’s policy prohibits gifts above CHF 200 from vendors.
external_claim: Vendor gifts over CHF 200 are not allowed under company policy.
reason_same: Same threshold and prohibition.
reason_not_same: ‘Above’ vs ‘over’ and policy exception language may differ; external might ignore approved exceptions.

internal_fact: The model achieved 3% higher accuracy on Benchmark X with increased computational cost.
external_claim: Benchmark X accuracy improved by 3% while compute requirements increased.
reason_same: Both describe the same accuracy gain and trade-off.
reason_not_same: ‘Computational cost’ may include training + inference; ‘compute requirements’ might be read as only inference or only training.

internal_fact: The algorithm converged after approximately 1,200 iterations.
external_claim: Convergence occurred at around 1,200 iterations.
reason_same: Near-identical numeric claim; simple paraphrase.
reason_not_same: ‘Approximately’ vs ‘around’ is similar, but ‘converged’ could mean strict threshold, while ‘occurred’ could be loosely defined.

internal_fact: The system maintained uptime above 99.95% over the last 12 months.
external_claim: Over the last 12 months, uptime did not fall below 99.95%.
reason_same: Same floor and same period.
reason_not_same: Internal may refer to SLA-measured uptime; external might imply observed uptime for all users, including planned maintenance.

internal_fact: Failure rates declined to 0.6% following the redesign.
external_claim: After the redesign, failures occurred in 0.6% of cases.
reason_same: Same rate and causal ordering.
reason_not_same: ‘Declined to’ implies a before/after comparison; external could be read as only reporting post-redesign rate without confirming decline.

internal_fact: Latency decreased from 240 ms to 190 ms after migrating 70% of workloads.
external_claim: After migrating 70% of workloads, latency fell to 190 ms from 240 ms.
reason_same: Same before/after metrics and migration fraction.
reason_not_same: Could differ on percentile (p50 vs p95) if not stated; also migration may correlate rather than cause.

internal_fact: The prototype reduced energy consumption by 18% over six months of testing.
external_claim: During six months of testing, the prototype lowered energy use by 18%.
reason_same: Same period and reduction.
reason_not_same: ‘Energy consumption’ could be total facility energy; ‘energy use’ might be per-unit or per-transaction.

internal_fact: The security patch addressed 7 vulnerabilities rated 'high' severity.
external_claim: Seven high-severity vulnerabilities were remediated in the security patch.
reason_same: Same count and severity class.
reason_not_same: ‘Addressed’ could include mitigations or partial fixes; ‘remediated’ implies fully fixed.

internal_fact: The new battery chemistry reached 500 charge cycles at 80% capacity retention.
external_claim: The battery retained 80% capacity after 500 charge cycles.
reason_same: Same milestone restated.
reason_not_same: Internal might be lab conditions; external reads as real-world performance.

internal_fact: The firmware update improved Bluetooth stability under heavy interference.
external_claim: Bluetooth stability improved after the firmware update, especially under interference.
reason_same: Both report improved stability in interference conditions.
reason_not_same: Internal is conditional (‘under heavy interference’); external could be interpreted as broader, general stability.

internal_fact: The team froze feature development for Release 3.2 on 10 Jan 2026.
external_claim: Release 3.2 entered feature-freeze on 10 Jan 2026.
reason_same: Same milestone and date.
reason_not_same: ‘Froze feature development’ might allow critical exceptions; ‘entered feature-freeze’ may imply a stricter process gate.

internal_fact: The API rate limit is 120 requests per minute per token.
external_claim: Each token is limited to 120 API requests per minute.
reason_same: Same limit and scope.
reason_not_same: Internal says ‘per token’ explicitly; external could be misread as per user or per account.

internal_fact: The team reduced build time by 35% after caching dependencies.
external_claim: Dependency caching cut build time by about 35%.
reason_same: Same change and cause in brief.
reason_not_same: ‘About’ introduces uncertainty; build time metric might differ (CI vs local)

internal_fact: The recommendation system increased click-through rate from 2.1% to 2.4% in A/B test #17.
external_claim: In A/B test #17, CTR rose from 2.1% to 2.4% with the new recommender.
reason_same: Same test and same numbers.
reason_not_same: Could differ if internal CTR is unique users vs impressions; ‘new recommender’ implies a single cause rather than combined changes.

internal_fact: The R&D roadmap targets a 2027 launch for the next-generation sensor.
external_claim: The next-generation sensor is aimed for launch in 2027.
reason_same: Both indicate a 2027 target launch.
reason_not_same: ‘Targets’ is aspirational; ‘is aimed’ could be interpreted as more committed or as a public promise.

internal_fact: The dataset used for training contained 12.3 million labeled samples.
external_claim: Training used roughly 12 million labeled samples.
reason_same: Rounding preserves scale and meaning for many contexts.
reason_not_same: 0.3 million difference may matter for fairness, coverage, and compute estimates; ‘roughly’ could be read as approximate rather than counted.

internal_fact: The new chip tape-out occurred in October 2025.
external_claim: The chip taped out in October 2025.
reason_same: Same milestone and month.
reason_not_same: ‘New chip’ may specify which chip; external could be interpreted as the whole program rather than one variant.

internal_fact: The RMA rate stayed below 1% during the first 90 days after launch.
external_claim: For the first 90 days post-launch, RMA remained under 1%.
reason_same: Same threshold and window.
reason_not_same: ‘Stayed below’ implies continuous measurement; external could be interpreted as an average under 1%.

internal_fact: The product passed IEC 62368-1 safety testing on 5 Nov 2025.
external_claim: IEC 62368-1 safety testing was passed on 5 Nov 2025.
reason_same: Same standard and date.
reason_not_same: Internal may refer to a specific lab’s test; external could be read as certification granted, which is a different step.

internal_fact: The app store rating increased from 4.2 to 4.3 after the December update.
external_claim: After the December update, the app rating rose to 4.3 from 4.2.
reason_same: Same change and anchor.
reason_not_same: Internal might be weighted rating; external implies overall visible rating which can differ by region.

internal_fact: The deprecation notice gives customers 18 months to migrate.
external_claim: Customers are given an 18-month migration window in the deprecation notice.
reason_same: Same migration period.
reason_not_same: ‘To migrate’ could mean complete migration; ‘window’ could be interpreted as time until partial migration or end-of-support.

internal_fact: The code review policy requires two reviewers for changes over 300 lines.
external_claim: Changes larger than 300 lines need approval from two reviewers.
reason_same: Same size threshold and reviewer count.
reason_not_same: ‘Requires’ vs ‘need approval’ could imply different enforcement; ‘over’ vs ‘larger than’ may treat exactly 300 lines differently.

internal_fact: The team estimates a 10–15% throughput gain from the new pipeline.
external_claim: The new pipeline is expected to improve throughput by around 12%.
reason_same: A midpoint estimate approximates the range.
reason_not_same: A single-point expectation erases uncertainty and could be misleading if gains fall at 10% or 15%.

internal_fact: The cloud migration moved 55% of services to region eu-central-1 by Dec 2025.
external_claim: By Dec 2025, about 55% of services had migrated to eu-central-1.
reason_same: Same fraction, region, and date.
reason_not_same: ‘Moved’ suggests completed cutover; ‘had migrated’ could include partially migrated services or traffic shadowing.

internal_fact: The feature is enabled for 20% of users via staged rollout.
external_claim: A staged rollout has turned the feature on for about 20% of users.
reason_same: Same rollout approach and exposure.
reason_not_same: ‘Enabled’ might mean can access; ‘turned on’ might imply actively used; also ‘about’ adds fuzziness.

internal_fact: In adults aged 65–80 with preexisting cardiovascular disease, daily walking reduced hospitalization rates by 9%.
external_claim: Among adults 65–80 with cardiovascular disease, daily walking was linked to a 9% lower hospitalization rate.
reason_same: Both keep the age band, condition, and 9% reduction framing.
reason_not_same: ‘Reduced’ suggests causal effect; ‘linked to’ is associational language. Also ‘preexisting’ is dropped which may matter.

internal_fact: The trial met its primary endpoint at 12 weeks.
external_claim: At week 12, the primary endpoint was achieved in the trial.
reason_same: Same endpoint timing expressed differently.
reason_not_same: ‘Met’ can imply pre-specified statistical criteria; ‘achieved’ can be read as clinically meaningful without the same statistical bar.

internal_fact: No serious adverse events were reported during Phase II.
external_claim: Phase II reported no adverse events categorized as serious.
reason_same: Both state absence of serious AEs in Phase II reporting.
reason_not_same: ‘Reported’ depends on reporting completeness; ‘categorized’ depends on classification—could differ by adjudication.

internal_fact: Patient adherence remained above 90% throughout the study period.
external_claim: Adherence stayed over 90% for the duration of the study.
reason_same: Same threshold and full-study scope.
reason_not_same: Internal could be medication adherence; external could be visit adherence; metric definition may differ.

internal_fact: Median survival increased by 2.4 months relative to placebo.
external_claim: Compared with placebo, median survival improved by 2.4 months.
reason_same: Direct paraphrase with same effect size.
reason_not_same: Could differ if internal is overall survival and external reads as progression-free survival; metric type not explicit.

internal_fact: Results were replicated within a 95% confidence interval.
external_claim: Replication fell within the 95% confidence bounds.
reason_same: Same statistical statement with synonymous phrasing.
reason_not_same: ‘Within a 95% CI’ could mean overlap of intervals; ‘confidence bounds’ could refer to prediction intervals or different constructs.

internal_fact: Measurement error accounted for less than 5% of the variance.
external_claim: Less than 5% of variance was attributable to measurement error.
reason_same: Same variance attribution statement.
reason_not_same: Could differ if internal refers to explained variance in one model while external implies total variance in the phenomenon.

internal_fact: The hypothesis was rejected at α = 0.05.
external_claim: At the 5% significance level, the hypothesis was rejected.
reason_same: Identical statistical threshold restated.
reason_not_same: Could differ if a correction for multiple comparisons is assumed internally but not externally.

internal_fact: Higher coffee consumption was associated with lower reported levels of depression.
external_claim: Lower reported depression levels were observed among higher coffee consumers.
reason_same: Both preserve association (not causation) and direction.
reason_not_same: External could be read as implying a causal effect; also ‘reported levels’ vs ‘depression’ could mean different instruments.

internal_fact: The correlation remained stable across three independent samples.
external_claim: Across three independent samples, the correlation did not materially change.
reason_same: Both indicate stability across samples.
reason_not_same: ‘Stable’ may allow minor variation; ‘did not materially change’ introduces a judgment threshold.

internal_fact: The vaccine showed 74% efficacy against symptomatic disease in the 18–55 cohort.
external_claim: In participants aged 18–55, efficacy against symptomatic disease was 74%.
reason_same: Same cohort, endpoint, and efficacy percentage.
reason_not_same: Internal could specify a particular variant or time window; external may omit those conditions.

internal_fact: Dose-limiting toxicity was not observed up to 200 mg/day.
external_claim: No dose-limiting toxicity was seen at doses up to 200 mg/day.
reason_same: Equivalent phrasing of same safety finding and dose ceiling.
reason_not_same: ‘Not observed’ could reflect limited sample size; ‘was seen’ could be interpreted as stronger evidence of absence.

internal_fact: The study enrolled 240 patients across 6 hospitals between 2019 and 2020.
external_claim: Between 2019 and 2020, 240 patients from 6 hospitals were enrolled.
reason_same: Same counts, sites, and period.
reason_not_same: ‘Across 6 hospitals’ could include multi-site networks; ‘from 6 hospitals’ implies patients originated there—subtle sourcing difference.

internal_fact: The endpoint was met in 8 of 14 study sites.
external_claim: Eight of the fourteen study sites met the endpoint.
reason_same: Same fraction restated.
reason_not_same: Internal could mean site-level analysis; external might be read as patient-level success aggregated by site.

internal_fact: The model’s error rate decreased by 0.7 percentage points after recalibration.
external_claim: After recalibration, the error rate fell by 0.7 percentage points.
reason_same: Same effect size and intervention.
reason_not_same: Internal might be absolute percentage-point change; external could be misread as relative percent change.

internal_fact: Serum LDL decreased by 12 mg/dL after 8 weeks on treatment.
external_claim: After 8 weeks of treatment, LDL fell by 12 mg/dL.
reason_same: Same biomarker change and timeframe.
reason_not_same: Internal specifies serum LDL; external omits ‘serum’ and could be interpreted as calculated LDL or a different measurement context.

internal_fact: The p-value for the primary outcome was 0.048.
external_claim: The primary outcome was significant at p = 0.048.
reason_same: Same p-value restated as significance.
reason_not_same: ‘Significant’ depends on pre-specified alpha and adjustments; internal gives a number without asserting significance.

internal_fact: The trial protocol allowed rescue medication after day 14.
external_claim: Rescue medication could be used after day 14 under the protocol.
reason_same: Same permission and timing.
reason_not_same: ‘Allowed’ might have conditions; ‘could be used’ may imply broader discretion.

internal_fact: The effect persisted through the 6-month follow-up.
external_claim: The effect was still present at the 6-month follow-up.
reason_same: Same persistence claim and timepoint.
reason_not_same: ‘Through’ could mean continuously across months; ‘at’ could mean only observed at that single visit.

internal_fact: Adverse events led to discontinuation in 3.1% of participants.
external_claim: About 3% of participants discontinued due to adverse events.
reason_same: Rounded percentage and same causal reason.
reason_not_same: Rounding may hide clinically relevant threshold; ‘due to’ implies attribution certainty vs internal could be investigator-assessed.

internal_fact: The company is transitioning from third-party fact-checking to a community notes model in the U.S.
external_claim: In the U.S., the company is moving from third-party fact-checking toward community notes.
reason_same: Same shift and jurisdiction; reorder only.
reason_not_same: ‘Transitioning’ could mean already implemented; ‘moving toward’ may imply earlier stage or partial rollout.

internal_fact: The previous moderation strategy relied on independent fact-checkers certified through IFCN.
external_claim: The prior moderation approach centered on IFCN-certified independent fact-checkers.
reason_same: Same reliance and certification attribute preserved.
reason_not_same: ‘Relied on’ could include other tools; ‘centered on’ implies primary mechanism, potentially overstating exclusivity.

internal_fact: To date, global sustainability regulations have had no material impact on results of operations.
external_claim: So far, sustainability regulations have not materially affected results of operations.
reason_same: Both say no material impact so far.
reason_not_same: ‘No material impact’ is an accounting term; ‘not materially affected’ might be interpreted more loosely.

internal_fact: The company sources 60% of its electricity from renewables in 2025.
external_claim: In 2025, renewables provided about 60% of the company’s electricity.
reason_same: Same proportion and year; paraphrase.
reason_not_same: ‘Sources’ could mean contracted vs physically delivered; external could be read as actual grid mix consumed.

internal_fact: The new disclosure rule applies to firms with revenue above €750 million.
external_claim: Firms with revenue over €750 million fall under the new disclosure rule.
reason_same: Same threshold-based applicability.
reason_not_same: ‘Above’ vs ‘over’ could treat exactly €750 million differently; legal scope may hinge on precise wording.

internal_fact: The press release stated the incident was contained within 90 minutes.
external_claim: The company said the incident was contained in about 90 minutes.
reason_same: Same containment window with mild rounding.
reason_not_same: ‘Contained’ could be operationally defined; ‘about 90 minutes’ weakens precision and may imply uncertainty.

internal_fact: The board added two independent directors effective 1 Jan 2026.
external_claim: Two independent directors joined the board on 1 Jan 2026.
reason_same: Same number, independence status, and date.
reason_not_same: Internal ‘added’ could include appointment but not seating; external ‘joined’ implies they began serving that day.

internal_fact: Emissions fell 20% relative to 2015 levels after the policy change.
external_claim: Relative to 2015, emissions were 20% lower following the policy change.
reason_same: Same baseline and reduction described.
reason_not_same: Internal implies causation (‘after the policy change’); external could be read as correlation in time rather than causal effect.

internal_fact: The regulator opened a consultation period from 3 Feb to 31 Mar 2026.
external_claim: A public consultation runs from 3 Feb through 31 Mar 2026.
reason_same: Same dates and event; paraphrase.
reason_not_same: ‘Opened’ by regulator implies official authority; ‘public consultation runs’ omits who and could refer to a different consultation.

internal_fact: Institutional trust declined by 9 points between 2018 and 2023.
external_claim: From 2018 to 2023, institutional trust fell by nine points.
reason_same: Same magnitude and interval.
reason_not_same: Internal may be an index with sampling error; external treats it as a precise fact across populations.

internal_fact: The report notes the change may increase polarization risks.
external_claim: The report warns the change could raise polarization risks.
reason_same: ‘Notes’ and ‘warns’ both convey concern about increased risk.
reason_not_same: ‘Warns’ is stronger and implies higher confidence or urgency than ‘notes’.

internal_fact: The company committed to net-zero for Scope 1 and 2 by 2040.
external_claim: The company targets net-zero Scope 1 and 2 emissions by 2040.
reason_same: Commitment/target both indicate the same 2040 net-zero intention.
reason_not_same: ‘Committed’ can be binding and accountable; ‘targets’ may be aspirational without enforcement.

internal_fact: The policy allows exceptions when approved by the compliance officer.
external_claim: Exceptions are permitted with compliance officer approval under the policy.
reason_same: Same conditional allowance.
reason_not_same: Internal may imply rare exceptions; external could be read as broadly permitting exceptions so long as approval exists.

internal_fact: The company’s code of conduct prohibits gifts above CHF 200 from vendors.
external_claim: Vendor gifts over CHF 200 are prohibited under the code of conduct.
reason_same: Same prohibition and threshold.
reason_not_same: Exact boundary ambiguity (CHF 200 exactly) and potential pre-approved exemptions are not represented in external claim.

internal_fact: The spokesperson said there was no evidence of customer data exfiltration.
external_claim: The spokesperson said customer data exfiltration was not evidenced.
reason_same: Same claim of no evidence, restated.
reason_not_same: ‘No evidence’ does not equal ‘did not happen’; external phrasing may be interpreted as stronger denial.

internal_fact: Moral responsibility diminishes when autonomy is significantly constrained.
external_claim: Significant constraints on autonomy reduce moral responsibility.
reason_same: Both assert the same relationship between autonomy constraints and responsibility.
reason_not_same: ‘Diminishes’ suggests a gradient; ‘reduce’ can be read as categorical or unspecified degree.

internal_fact: Justice requires equal consideration of interests, not equal outcomes.
external_claim: Justice demands interests be considered equally even when outcomes differ.
reason_same: Both maintain equal consideration and reject outcome equality as requirement.
reason_not_same: External could be read as endorsing outcome differences, while internal only says equal outcomes aren’t required.

internal_fact: Freedom involves the capacity to act otherwise, not merely absence of coercion.
external_claim: Freedom is more than non-coercion; it includes the ability to choose differently.
reason_same: Both define freedom as including alternative possibilities beyond coercion absence.
reason_not_same: ‘Capacity to act otherwise’ can be metaphysical; ‘choose differently’ can be interpreted psychologically or socially.

internal_fact: Ethical legitimacy depends partly on procedural fairness.
external_claim: Procedural fairness contributes to ethical legitimacy.
reason_same: Both say procedural fairness matters for legitimacy.
reason_not_same: ‘Depends partly’ implies it is necessary among factors; ‘contributes’ could be read as optional or minor.

internal_fact: Meaning arises from shared practices over extended periods of time.
external_claim: Over time, shared practices generate meaning.
reason_same: Both connect meaning with shared practice over time.
reason_not_same: ‘Extended periods’ stresses long duration; external could include short-term trends as ‘over time’.

internal_fact: Transparency can improve accountability but may reduce privacy in some contexts.
external_claim: Greater transparency can raise accountability while sometimes limiting privacy.
reason_same: Same trade-off relationship expressed.
reason_not_same: ‘May reduce’ vs ‘limiting’ implies different strength; ‘some contexts’ vs ‘sometimes’ changes scope.

internal_fact: Consent is valid only when participants understand material risks.
external_claim: Consent requires understanding of material risks to be valid.
reason_same: Same necessary condition for valid consent.
reason_not_same: ‘Only when’ can imply strict requirement; ‘requires’ may allow partial understanding depending on interpretation.

internal_fact: Legitimacy is strengthened when decisions are publicly justifiable.
external_claim: Publicly justifiable decisions tend to enhance legitimacy.
reason_same: Both link public justification to legitimacy improvement.
reason_not_same: ‘Strengthened’ sounds causal; ‘tend to’ is probabilistic and weaker.

internal_fact: Fairness metrics can conflict, making single-score optimization difficult.
external_claim: Because fairness metrics can conflict, optimizing a single score is often hard.
reason_same: Both say metric conflict complicates optimization.
reason_not_same: ‘Can conflict’ is possibility; ‘because ...’ suggests conflict is a given in the scenario.

internal_fact: Collective responsibility increases as coordination among actors increases.
external_claim: As actors coordinate more, collective responsibility tends to rise.
reason_same: Both state a positive relationship between coordination and collective responsibility.
reason_not_same: ‘Increases as’ implies monotonic relationship; ‘tends to’ allows exceptions and could be seen as weaker.

internal_fact: A policy is ethically defensible if it balances harms and benefits transparently.
external_claim: Transparent balancing of harms and benefits can make a policy ethically defensible.
reason_same: Both say transparent trade-off balancing supports ethical defensibility.
reason_not_same: ‘If’ implies sufficiency; ‘can make’ implies not always sufficient.

internal_fact: Equality of opportunity does not guarantee equality of outcomes.
external_claim: Equal opportunity can still result in unequal outcomes.
reason_same: Same idea restated.
reason_not_same: ‘Does not guarantee’ is formal; ‘can still’ might be read as endorsing unequal outcomes as acceptable.

internal_fact: Bias mitigation may shift errors across groups rather than eliminate them.
external_claim: Reducing bias can redistribute errors between groups.
reason_same: Both describe trade-off/redistribution nature of mitigation.
reason_not_same: ‘May’ vs ‘can’ differs; ‘redistribute’ implies a definite shift whereas ‘may shift’ is conditional.

internal_fact: Trust depends on both competence and perceived intent.
external_claim: Competence and perceived intent both shape trust.
reason_same: Same two-factor view of trust.
reason_not_same: ‘Depends on’ could imply necessity; ‘shape’ could allow trust to be formed without one factor.

internal_fact: Accountability mechanisms work best when incentives align with stated values.
external_claim: Aligned incentives help accountability mechanisms function well.
reason_same: Both link incentive alignment to effective accountability.
reason_not_same: ‘Work best’ implies comparative optimum; ‘help’ is weaker and could imply they are not essential.

internal_fact: Alexandra Bastedo was a vegetarian and an animal welfare advocate.
external_claim: Alexandra Bastedo followed a vegetarian lifestyle.
reason_same: A vegetarian lifestyle is a concise restatement of being a vegetarian.
reason_not_same: ‘Lifestyle’ can imply a consistent long-term practice and may omit nuance (e.g., periods of vegetarianism, motive, or strictness).

internal_fact: WizzyPro is a Nigerian record producer signed to BeatBox.
external_claim: BeatBox has signed at least one Nigerian record producer.
reason_same: If WizzyPro is signed and is Nigerian, then BeatBox has signed a Nigerian producer.
reason_not_same: External claim is weaker and could be interpreted as referring to current roster or a different time period than the internal statement.
